critique: The document is an executive order detailing the assignment of US government employees with special qualifications to foreign governments. It outlines the process for requesting, approving, and administering these assignments, including financial and logistical considerations. There is no apparent ideological tilt, immigration stance, or focus on security vs. liberty. The order seems to expand executive power by granting the Secretary of State significant authority in administering the program. It also appears to favor federal control by centralizing the assignment process through the Department of State.
